title: Torta Salgada de Liquidificador (Savory Brazilian Blender Casserole)

instructions.1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease an 8-inch springform pan with 1 teaspoon butter. Dust with 1 teaspoon flour, shaking out excess.
instructions.2: Combine milk, 1 cup flour, eggs, Parmesan cheese, 1 tablespoon oil, baking powder, and nutmeg in a blender; blend until batter is smooth, about 1 minute. Pour into prepared pan.
instructions.3: Heat 2 tablespoons oil and 1 tablespoon butter in a large skillet over medium heat until butter is melted. Add leeks, fennel, and salt; cook and stir until softened, about 2 minutes. Spoon over batter in the pan. Arrange Brie cheese on top.
instructions.4: Bake in the preheated oven until center is firm and edges start to brown, 18 to 20 minutes. Let cool in the pan, 10 minutes. Run a knife around the edge of the pan to loosen edges and release the sides. Cut into slices.

questions.question: In Step 4, is the oven from Step 1 being used?
Is oven from Step 1 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is batter from Step 2 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is excess from Step 1 still available in Step 2?
Is baking powder live after Step 2?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 4?
If we skip Step 1, is it still valid to use the oven in Step 4?
Can we heat (Step 3) and bake (Step 4) at the same time?
